info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 2, game 7.

(1, 1).clue: Fittingly, Francois Boucher painted "The Toilet of" this Roman goddess for Madame de Pompadour

(2, 1).clue: Madylin Sweeten plays the daughter & her brothers play the twin sons on this sitcom

(5, 1).clue: Often, a route along a waterway isn't called a street or ave., but this, like Boston's Memorial & Storrow

(6, 1).clue: If you're dining alfresco, you're dining here

(1, 2).clue: Donatello was born in this city, where he assisted Ghiberti in finishing the bronze doors of the baptistery

(2, 2).clue: She hosted "True Tales of Teen Trauma" on MTV & also played Sarah on "Party of Five"

(4, 2).clue: In a classic book, "its head was a small sack stuffed with straw, with eyes, nose and mouth painted on it"

(5, 2).clue: Sodium vapor is a common type of these, which help prevent crime & traffic accidents

(6, 2).clue: A 16th century hangman gave us this name for the framework over an oil well

(4, 3).clue: A farrow is a litter of these

(6, 4).clue: From the Latin for "yield", this verb can mean "to die" or to yield to temptation

(2, 5).clue: This '80s sitcom was based on a TV movie in which Tony Randall played a gay man

(3, 5).clue: "A chicken in every pot and a car in every garage"

(5, 5).clue: She became a symbol of urban indifference when she was killed in 1964 in earshot of her Queens neighbors

(6, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from a winery.)  The science of growing grapes is viticulture; the science of making wine is known as this

(6, 2).clue: According to Genesis 4, he was the middle child
